page.title: 05MR.WILLIAMS (cont.)
page.content: in Colwyn District twice. There is a lot of traffic in Trefnant especially in summer when the holiday makers go through on their way to Rhyl, but the villagers don't seem to have any objection to this. Although Mr Williams is officially retired, he still runs the farm and he used to be very busy. He used to be Mayor of Trefnant in 1980-81, he has also been on the Colwyn-Aled Rural and Parish Councils. He has been to Buckingham Palace a number of times to the Garden Parties, Princess Anne has also been to his house, so have Prince Charles and Princess Diana. Trefnant is situated between two rivers, the Elwy and the Clwyd, they run on and join in Rhuddlan then they go into the sea.
